title: Geographical targeting of active case finding for tuberculosis in Pakistan using hotspots identified by artificial intelligence software (SPOT-TB): study protocol for a pragmatic stepped wedge cluster randomised control trial
analysis_techniques: Bayesian modeling; Cluster randomization; Randomized controlled trial
research_description: This study investigates the use of AI to geographically target active case finding for tuberculosis (TB) in Pakistan, using AI-based software (MATCH-AI) to predict TB hotspots. The research aims to evaluate the effectiveness of AI-based targeting compared to traditional methods in improving TB detection rates.
research_results: The protocol outlines the implementation of a stepped wedge cluster randomised control trial, using Bayesian modeling to evaluate the impact of AI-driven geographical targeting on TB case detection. The expected outcome is increased TB case detection in areas targeted by AI.
future_research: Future research could investigate the scalability of AI-based targeting methods for TB detection in other high-burden regions, as well as assess the cost-effectiveness and ethical considerations of AI-driven healthcare interventions.
